meanings.definition: To divide into separate, self-contained units or modules.
meanings.sent1: The engineer modularized the software for easier maintenance.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to modularize their production process for efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef modularized the ingredients, making it easier to prepare the dish.
meanings.sent4: She modularized her study notes, organizing them into manageable sections.
meanings.sent5: The teacher modularized the lesson plan, breaking it down into smaller topics.

meanings.definition: Made up of separate, self-contained units or modules.
meanings.sent1: The modularized furniture was easy to assemble.
meanings.sent2: The new computer system was designed to be modularized for flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The modularized puzzle was challenging to put together.
meanings.sent4: Her modularized wardrobe allowed for easy mix-and-match outfits.
meanings.sent5: The modularized building blocks clicked together perfectly.
